item.title: New Borderlands 4 Update Buffs Vault Hunters
item.content:encoded:
GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

Borderlands 4 just received a major update on PC, PlayStation 5, and Xbox Series X|S that buffs the game's four Vault Hunters to make their many builds more viable.

Developer Gearbox Software took to the game's official website on October 2 to detail the latest update. In the blog post, the studio said the focus was to create "greater build diversity by adjusting underperforming skills." This includes tweaks like buffing the Forgeknight Amon in general so he's as strong as the other Vault Hunters, increasing the Exo-Soldier Rafa's summons and the Siren Vex's melee power to make those builds better in the endgame, and adjusting the Gravitar Harlowe's Stasis ability to ensure it's "getting value" for you.

While sending the Vault Hunters to the gym for strength training is the main highlight of this new update, Gearbox Software also made some other changes to the looter-shooter. This includes buffing the weekly Big Encore boss, moving Maurice’s Black Market Vending Machine and altering its available offerings, and adding an auto-clearing of Borderlands 4's stale shaders to prevent performance degradation on some PCs.

Borderlands 4 launched on September 12 to a favorable critical reception. In our Borderlands 4 review, critic Jordan Ramee awarded the game a 7/10, saying, "All in all, if uncovering loot, crafting builds, and unleashing chaotic mayhem is what you're looking for, Borderlands 4 has you covered." While currently available on PC, PlayStation 5, and Xbox Series X|S, a Nintendo Switch 2 port is coming--though it was delayed indefinitely--and a new Vault Hunter joins the looter-shooter's roster in 2026.

With all of that said, you can check out the full patch notes for Borderlands 4's October 2 update down below:

Change List

Weekly Activities:

  • Weekly Big Encore Boss has switched to a tougher variant of a different existing boss with an even more rewarding loot pool for those that take it on.
  • The Weekly Wildcard Mission has changed. These missions feature a guaranteed Legendary drop that you can repeatedly earn to get your ideal roll.
  • Maurice’s Black Market Vending Machine has moved to another location and changed its offerings. Remember, while the location is the same, your vending machine items are different from other players, so ask around to see if someone has the item you’re looking for!

Additional Changes:

item.title: Here Are The Black Ops 7 Beta Loadouts Used By The Game's Directors
item.content:encoded:
GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

Call of Duty: Black Ops 7's multiplayer beta begins today, October 2, and if you're looking for an edge on the battlefield, we've got something that might interest you.

The game's top directors have shared their loadouts, and given they're the ones who made the game, they might know a thing or two about what a solid loadout might look like. Matt Scronce, Black Ops 7's design director, is running with the Peacekeeper MK1 and pinpoint grenades, along with the Ninja, Assassin, and Dexterity perks and Active Camo as a field upgrade.

Associate design director Lawrence Metten, meanwhile, is playing with M8A1 as a primary weapon, with Psyche grenades and the Ninja, Hunter's Instinct, and Dexterity perks. Metten is also using the Overkill wildcard to get a second main weapon, and they chose the Echo 12 shotgun.

Associate creative director Miles Leslie chose the MXR-17 as his primary weapon, along with the Scavenger, Looper, and Bankroll perks. Leslie also chose the Trophy System as a field upgrade.

Check out the full loadouts for Scronce, Metten, and Leslie below, as shared by Activision with GameSpot. Of course, what works for them may not work for you. For more, be sure to check out a rundown of all the guns in Black Ops 7.

The Black Ops 7 multiplayer beta is available in early access beginning today for people who preorder the game or subscribe to Game Pass--which just got more expensive. Alternatively, people who watched an hour of Call of Duty: Next on Twitch this week received a code for early access. Xfinity subscribers can get in today as well. For everyone else, the Black Ops 7 open beta begins on October 5.

Battlefield 6 is arriving later this month, and Achievement and Trophy hunters now have an idea of what they need to do when it arrives.

Exophase has shared all 53 of the Xbox Achievements in Battlefield 6, which will show up as Trophies on PlayStation 5. On Xbox, the Achievements account for 1,185 Gamerscore points.

There are 11 secret tasks, including awards for playing 74 matches in any version of Battle Royale or winning seven matches in Battle Royale: Duos. Some of the awards appear to have random numbers chosen for their goals, including stunning enemies 316 times or reviving teammates 1988 times.

Naturally, players can also pick up Trophies/Achievements simply by playing through the campaign, and there are some awards that are tied to finding specific collectibles throughout the game.

Xbox players can currently pre-load Battlefield 6, but PlayStation 5 and PC owners have to wait until October 3 to do the same. EA feels bullish enough about Battlefield 6 to shoot a commercial that mocks rival franchise Call of Duty's celebrity operators. It's a bold move, considering that industry experts still expect Call of Duty: Black Ops 7 to outperform Battlefield 6 by a wide margin.

Battlefield 6 will be released on October 10 on Xbox Series X|S, PlayStation 5, and PC. The full list of achievements/trophies can be found below.

item.title: Call Of Duty: Black Ops 7 Server Status - Is Black Ops 7 Down During The Beta?
item.content:encoded:
GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

The Call of Duty: Black Ops 7 beta early access has arrived, and with the huge popularity of the franchise combined with the specific Black Ops 7 beta start time, you may face some connectivity issues. Some of those issues could be down to your own PC, specifically whether it meets Activision's requirements for anti-cheat protection. Luckily, we've got all of the information you need on how to turn on your PC's secure boot if you're struggling. However, there's also every chance that the servers are struggling to cope with the influx of players and are facing instability, or emergency maintenance is underway. Fear not, we've got the latest on the Black Ops 7 server status so you can get back into the mix during the limited-time beta.

Is Black Ops 7 down?

The Call of Duty: Black Ops 7 servers are currently active with no reported issues, as the beta has now started for early access players. They will go live on Sunday, October 5, 2025 at 10AM PT / 1PM ET / 6PM BST for everyone else.
